poem:
### Stones of the Unheard

The walls rise higher  
where words should bridge.  
Voices, unlayered, thin in the  
unrolled scroll of dusk.  
Refuge in shadows,  
the hum of sonless fields,  
a hearth stilled.  
History blinks its sleep,  
while hands clutch the lament:  
unwritten, uncarried  
beyond the scars of sand.  
Within the dust,  
the stones remember.
